description: Extension of ground floor retail unit(s) and conversion of existing first / second floor residential accommodation (5 units) and addition of two floors to provide a total of 12 self-contained flats, with first floor roof terraces.
decision_conditions: The proposal represents an undesirable overdevelopment of the site, resulting in a cramped development having an overlooking impact on neighbouring properties, creating a lack of internal and external amenity space and would result in poor living conditions for future residents and neighbouring properties, contrary to Policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan. | On the information before it, the Local Planning Authority consider that it has no alternative but to refuse the application, as it has not been demonstrated that the parking provision and servicing arrangements proposed would meet the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority and not give rise to an unacceptable rise in the demand for on-street parking or interfere with the free flow and safety of pedestrian and vehicular traffic in the vicinity and that the proposal would be a sustainable form of development, contrary to Policies 9.1, 9.6 and 9.11 of the Council's adopted UDP. | On the information before it, the Local Planning Authority consider that it has no alternative but to refuse the application, as it has not been demonstrated that the development would incorporate necessary noise mitigation methods to ensure adequate living conditions for future occupiers and surrounding residents, contrary to Policy 4.11 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan.
